titleStmt.title: William E. Woodruff to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG2225

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
Louisville Oct 1865
To His Excellency
Thos. E. Bramlette Gov of Ky.
Dear Sir

Having resumed the practice of the Law in this City it is a matter of great convenience to have the right of qualifying Clients to such pleadings as may be required. Hence I have the honor to write and request at your hands the appointment of Notary Public if you will be pleased to grant it.

I have the honor to subscribe myself
Your Obdt Servt
Wm E. Woodruff
formerly Col 2d Ky Infty
Gen Woodruff is in evry way worthy of the appointment asked for by him, in the written communication -- I hope you will make the appointment

Notary Public
Jefferson Co
Wm E. Woodruff
apptd
30th Oct/65
